prompt_init: You will receive a text. Your task is to rephrase this text without modifying its meaning. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to rephrase this text without modifying its meaning. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
initial_story:
A US Army soldier stationed in South Korea has been detained in Russia, the US military says.

The Russian foreign ministry said the charges were not related to "politics or espionage", but to a "purely domestic crime".

The 34-year-old was not on official travel when he was held on 2 May in the city of Vladivostok, in Russia's Far East.

Sgt Black had been in the process of changing duty stations from South Korea to Fort Cavazos in the US state of Texas, according to a statement from the US Army.

But instead of returning to the US, he travelled through China to Vladivostok for personal reasons, US Army spokeswoman Cynthia Smith said in a statement.

According to Russian media, he was visiting a woman with whom he had a romantic relationship.

The soldier's mother, Melody Jones, confirmed to CBS that he was in Russia visiting his girlfriend.

"Please do not torture him [or] hurt him," Melody Jones said when asked about her message to the Russians.

Sgt Black enlisted as an infantryman in 2008 and was deployed to Iraq in 2009 and Afghanistan in 2013. He was most recently assigned to the Eighth Army, US Forces Korea at Camp Humphreys in South Korea.

He did not request official clearance and the defence department did not authorise his travel to China or Russia, the US Army said. There is no evidence he intended to remain in Russia.

The Russian interior ministry informed the US embassy in Moscow on 3 May that Sgt Black had been arrested a day earlier for theft of personal property.

He is being held at a pre-trial detention facility until his next hearing.

"The Army notified his family and the US Department of State is providing appropriate consular support to the Soldier in Russia," the US Army said in a statement on Monday.

National Security Council spokesman John Kirby told reporters the US is "aware of this case and other matters related to Russia".

At the White House briefing on Monday, Mr Kirby said he could not provide more details.

Russia is holding two other Americans. Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich has been detained since March 2023 on espionage charges.

Former US Marine Paul Whelan was accused of spying and sentenced to 16 years in prison in 2020.

Both men maintain their innocence, and the US government says the charges against them are baseless.
stories: A US Army personnel, based in South Korea, has been arrested in Russia and is being held for alleged theft, according to the US military. The arrest took place on May 2nd in Vladivostok, in Russia's Far East, while the soldier was not on official travel. The 34-year-old soldier, identified as Sgt Black, was en route from South Korea to Fort Cavazos in Texas, but decided to travel through China to Vladivostok for personal reasons. Russian media reports suggest he was visiting a woman he had a romantic relationship with. Sgt Black's mother has confirmed that he was in Russia to see his girlfriend. The US Army has stated that Sgt Black did not seek official approval for his travel to China or Russia and that there is no evidence indicating his intention to stay in Russia. The Russian interior ministry informed the US embassy in Moscow on May 3rd that Sgt Black was arrested for theft. He is being held at a pre-trial detention facility and will remain there until his next hearing. The US Army has notified his family, and the US Department of State is providing consular support. The US is also aware of the detention of two other Americans in Russia: Evan Gershkovich, a Wall Street Journal reporter detained in March 2023 on espionage charges, and Paul Whelan, a former US Marine sentenced to 16 years in prison in 2020 on spying charges. Both men deny the allegations, and the US government considers the charges against them to be groundless.

A US Army Sergeant, named Black and stationed in South Korea, has been detained in Russia for alleged theft, as reported by the US military. The arrest occurred on May 2nd in Vladivostok, in Russia's Far East, when the soldier was not on any official trip. The 34-year-old serviceman was journeying from South Korea to Fort Cavazos in Texas, but chose to go through China to Vladivostok for personal reasons. Reports from Russian media indicate that he was meeting with a woman he had a romantic connection with. Sgt Black's mother has verified that he was in Russia to see his girlfriend. The US Army has clarified that Sgt Black did not request official permission for his travel to China or Russia, and there is no information suggesting his plan to stay in Russia. The Russian interior ministry communicated to the US embassy in Moscow on May 3rd that Sgt Black was arrested for theft. He is being detained at a pre-trial detention center and will remain there until his next court appearance. The US Army has contacted his family, and the US Department of State is offering consular support. The US is also conscious of the detainment of two other Americans in Russia: Evan Gershkovich, a Wall Street Journal reporter apprehended in March 2023 on espionage charges, and Paul Whelan, a former US Marine given a 16-year sentence in 2020 on spying charges. Both individuals refute the accusations, and the US administration regards the charges against them as baseless.
